SEARCH
Package org.attribyte.snook.auth

Class BCryptAuthenticator<T>

java.lang.Object
org.attribyte.snook.auth.CookieAuthenticator<T>
org.attribyte.snook.auth.BCryptAuthenticator<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Authenticator<T>, LoginAuthenticator<T>
public abstract class BCryptAuthenticator<T> extends CookieAuthenticator<T> implements LoginAuthenticator<T>
An authenticator that checks username + password against a stored BCrypt hash. On valid password, sets a cookie that holds a random authentication token used for subsequent authentication.

  • Field Summary

  • Constructor Details

    • BCryptAuthenticator

      public BCryptAuthenticator(Cookies.CookieKey cookieKey, Function<com.google.common.hash.HashCode,String> credentialsValidator, com.google.common.collect.ImmutableMap<String,com.google.common.hash.HashCode> passwordHashMap, Function<AuthenticationToken,Boolean> saveCredentials)
      Creates the authenticator with a map that contains valid password hashes.
      Parameters:
      cookieKey - The key that identifies the cookie.
      credentialsValidator - A function that indicates if credentials are valid. Returns the authentication token exactly as saved.
      passwordHashMap - A map containing all valid password hashes.
      saveCredentials - A function that saves credentials, returning true if saved or false if not.

    • BCryptAuthenticator

      public BCryptAuthenticator(Cookies.CookieKey cookieKey, Function<com.google.common.hash.HashCode,String> validateToken, Function<String,com.google.common.hash.HashCode> selectPasswordHash, Function<AuthenticationToken,Boolean> saveCredentials)
      Creates the authenticator.
      Parameters:
      cookieKey - The key that identifies the cookie.
      validateToken - A function that returns the username associated with a token. Returns the authentication token exactly as saved.
      selectPasswordHash - A function that returns the password hash for a username or null if none.
      saveCredentials - A function that saves credentials, returning true if saved or false if not.

    • doLogin

      public T doLogin(String username, String password, int tokenLifetimeSeconds, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse resp) throws IOException
      Performs a login.

      If username + password is valid, creates a random token for the username, saves it and sets the value as a response cookie. Otherwise, does nothing and returns false.

      Specified by:
      doLogin in interface LoginAuthenticator<T>
      Parameters:
      username - The username.
      password - The password.
      tokenLifetimeSeconds - The authentication token lifetime in seconds.
      resp - The response.
      Returns:
      Was the password valid and token saved and set as a cookie?
      Throws:
      IOException - if credentials save failed.
